folder: Court Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Court Street, west side, north from Joralemon Street, as seen in 1876.
About 1876.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collu ction.

folder: Joralemon Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Joralemon Street, south side, between Court and Fulton Streets, a view of Murphy Park. On this site the new Municipal Building for the Borough of Brooklyn was erected.
About 1901.
Eugene L. Ambruster Collection

folder: Joralemon Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Joralemon Street, south side, at, adjoining and west side of Court Street. In the foreground is seen the Court Street Trolley Line. The corner building was occupied in 1929, by the Chemical National Bank.
1913
Eugene L. Ambruster Collection

folder: Court Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Court Street, east side, south from Joralemon to Livingston Streets. In the foreground is the Washington Building, erected about 1851 and torn down in 1924, behind which is a small municipal park. The building with the sloping roof is the Brooklyn Polytechnic Institute on Livingston Street. The Washington Building and the three buildings contiguous to it were later torn down and the Municipal Building erected on the site. The other structures are still standing in 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
View 1: 1914
View 2: 1922

folder: Court Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
Court Street, west side, north from Joralemon Street. At right, ]  is the Borough Hall Park. The building in the left center being demolished, is the Garfield Building: razed in 1925. It was built in 1881,]  and was one of the earliest office buildings of Brooklyn.
May 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, viewed from across Borough Hall Park. At the left, are
the steps leading into the Borough Hall Building. In the foreground, is
a pillar of the Fulton Elevated Lines. of the B.M.T.
May 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Court Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
42-44 Court Street, west side, near Joralemon Street, showing an interior of the Hamilton Building about 1900. It stood on the site of the present Temple Bar Building.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing a bridge on the second floor, connecting the two
Hamilton buildings.
About 1900.
Eugene L, Armbruster Collection.

(3)
The same, showing a stairway in the building.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4)
The same, another view.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Court Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
44 Court Street, at the N.W. corner of Joralemon Street.  A view of the Hamilton Building; the site is now occupied by the Temple Bar Building.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Joralemon Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
Joralemon Street, north side, at, adjoining and west of Court Street. A view of the Temple Bar Building since 1901, prior thereto it was the site of the Hamilton Building.
About 1905.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, from another angle.
About 1905.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Joralemon Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Joralemon Street, south side, east from Court Street, showing 45 Court Street in the foreground, and the old municipal building beyond it. Jacob M. Hopper, an undertaker, interred John Brown's body, of Harper's Ferry Va. fame, from this establishment.
1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
